website_summaries.verdict: UGREEN’s 4-way USB hub is fantastic for quickly sending data to and from your USB devices, or for maintaining a few desktop basics in one handy central location.
pros: USB 3.0 hub allows for ultra-fast data transfer speeds
Compatible with Mac, Windows, Chrome, and Linux
cons: For some reason, you cannot plug in and use a USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 device at the same time with this hub

customer_reviews.title: Questionable performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to replace my old usb2.0 hub for my Dell Inspiron 13 laptop. This hub works ok with usb flash drives, but it doesn't work very well with input devices (mouse and keyboard). There is about half-second delay between moving mouse and the cursor on the screen(which is very annoying to me). When I bypassed the hub and connected the mouse to the laptop directly, the problem disappears. Thus, it is the hub that created the delay. In addition, the hub has dc 5v power input connector, but the package didn't include the power adapter which also made me skeptical about this product. Not very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Compact and I Like the top plug as well.
customer_reviews.text: Works with no problems. What I didn't realize however is that you can't mix USB formats on the same hub. If you have a USB 3.0 device plugged into the hub, it won't accept a USB 2.0 device.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not all of the ports work. And my 3.0 HD can't be read from this. I'm just using it with one plug in my USB mouse
customer_reviews.author: Descena

customer_reviews.title: works great! I was having issues with my wireless keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: works great! I was having issues with my wireless keyboard and mouse after buying a new tower that seemed to interrupt the connection from the dongle, so I figured this hub would bring the dongle to a better position to keep the connection strong, and it did the trick without issue since. It's also made it easier to recharge other USB devices like my smartwatch and phone without having to reach under my desk to plug into my tower.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: I like the design but the build quality is another story
customer_reviews.text: I like the design but the build quality is another story....when I examine the wire and the build of the hub, the plastic and rubber is quite decent. But the joint where the wire meet the hub is too loose for my comfort. I tested the hub and even though it works great, the hub twists where the the wire inserts into it. Not a deal breaker if you plan to keep it in one place, but I would not recommend this for on the go if the quality is not check for issues like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good USB hub for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product (with my 2011 MacBook pro) for just over 2 months now and it has worked well throughout this time. Able to handle multiple low power USB devices like keyboards and USB receivers for mice. Has a port on the back to plug in a power source, but I have not tested this out to charge devices or power larger hard drives. Lightweight so it moves around when trying to plug things into it, but that can be fixed by sticking it down with adhesive. Overall, I am happy with the hub and would recommend it so far.
customer_reviews.author: I.S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and potentially dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: This item not recognized my Win10x64 system and started emitting a strong, burning smell as soon as I plugged it into my PC's USB3 port. I know the port is fine, but I tried another USB3 port,anyway, with the same results. Also plugged an old USB thumb drive into that port after I removed the hub, to ensure it was not damaged, but it seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Laczhazy

customer_reviews.title: It just works.
customer_reviews.text: With so many USB devices and limited USB ports on most laptops these days, a USB hub has become a necessity. I use this laptop solely at home so I wanted something with a longer cord so I could hide it out of the way. Most of them have very short cords and that makes perfect sense if you are constantly on the go. You want it as close to the computer as possible. For my use, this was perfect. I have bought USB hubs in the past that would give me connection problems. With this one, so far, so good. I have not had a single issue with it. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Outta Control

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, looks nice. I was surprised how useful I found having one port facing a different direction than the rest too. It's like a feature I didn't know I needed, but am very happy to have now. The shape is good for either taping/Velcroing/gluing it to the bottom of a desk, for concealed functionality. Or, just as easily, you could add rubber feet to the bottom to make sure it stays put.
customer_reviews.author: Rolfathan

customer_reviews.title: Extra USB ports.
customer_reviews.text: Writing this in Oct 2020 after owning this since late 2017 or early 2018. Initially bought it for my stage setup but it's found its way on my home studio desk. I have it tdouble sided tape mounted to the desk. It's perfect for me to plug in jump drives, iLoks and a phone charger when I need it. I love the topmount feature for quick accessibility. It's a versatile piece of gear and is well made. Re is the added bonus in the back to power it if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Andrew

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: bought due to 3ft cord to extend rear usb port on a desktop pc. front ports on a new case is on the top so was unable to access it as case sits under a desk and there is not enough clearance. tested all 4 ports with a powered usb 3.0 external hard drive and able to transfer a large file to the drive at sustained 135MB/s same speed as if it was plugged directly into the PC. now i can easily access usb ports on the desk and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sidewinder

customer_reviews.title: Works great & no need for an external power supply
customer_reviews.text: i have a couple multiple outlet usb strips. but with all of those i have to have them plugged in for them to be powered and function. with this the only power you need is what is supplied from your usb ports. the quality is top notch. the usb connections fit nice and tight, not even the slightest bit loose. a nice simple device that does what it should.
customer_reviews.author: MikenzCO

customer_reviews.title: Ugreen 4-Port USB (3.0) Hub (external power optional).
customer_reviews.text: I got both this Ugreen 4-Port USB (3.0) Hub and it's matching Ugreen external power adapter (matched set but sold separately). Working very well - no problems! I have 2 local data backup devices and a mobile power backup connected. Just what I needed. Everything is excellent. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: HappyDad

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has one port facing upwards. I have a usb wifi adapter that basically looks like a 10 inch long thumb drive tapering into an antenna. With my old hub, it had to stick out sideways and was hidden behind stuff. With this one, it sticks up above stuff. Anyway, the point is that with one facing a different direction from the others, you have more options for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. Schaff

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended.
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time. The package does not include a power adapter. I used a phone charging jack to power it. it works without power. I tested both ways. I used the hub to connect an external NVME solid-state drive enclosure. This is a High-speed hub. My read and write speeds were 450 Mbs. I also hooked up a thumb drive and downloaded some music. I restarted My computer with The power adapter plugged in and everything booted up fine. The hub stays cool. Good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! I connected this to my 3.0 PCIe card that has 4 USB Ports. Now I don't have to get on my knees under the desk and fish around for the USB Port. I connected an external Seagate Slim Hard Drive, GoPro Hero 5, Garmin Edge 1000, and Keyboard Mouse Bluetooth and it works great. Note: The Hub is powered by the PCIe card (see pic) which is supported by a 430 Watt PSU on the PC. I see no need for getting an additional power cord. I have not measured the Download speeds but it seems much faster than my onboard 2.0 USB Ports. This is an excellent price for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: working great right now
customer_reviews.text: working great right now. I was concerned that my external hard drive might now work - it does!!! I am not trying to charge with it though. So maybe only one powered usb works with several (I have a keyboard/mouse receiver, a printer, and a usb memory device all attached to it)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me, may not work well for you
customer_reviews.text: Great USB 3.0 speed for my external drives. Works consistently well for that. Whenever I plug in a usb stick or anything really, the hub disconnects and reconnects one or more of the external drives for a second and does not recognize the usb stick. The usb stick works perfectly fine in all of my non-hub usb ports including 3.0 ports.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I like the presentation of the product but I rather have bad presentation of the product then having a bad one . This USB hub is made very poorly . update
customer_reviews.author: AWSTECH

customer_reviews.title: Works well and can handle power hungry devices
customer_reviews.text: While my previous 4-port USB hub came with its own power supply, it would still only share 5 volts across all ports. It was a problem for me because I could only have at most one or two devices attached to it. This hub doesn't have this limitation. When plugged with its own power jack I can connect multiple power hungry devices and it handles it like a champ. Granted for such needs it would be better to find something bigger and more expensive, but it's good to know this hub is up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Roboto

customer_reviews.title: Works well, needs a sticky pad
customer_reviews.text: The device works as described. The only thing missing from the packaging is a two-sided sticky pad to hold the device in place. Small, lightweight items like this tend to move and twist as cables are plugged/unplugged. A sticky pad would go a long towards holding the device flat on a surface. Otherwise, it is just twisted around.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: You forget about it after a while. It just sits there, day after day and does it's job. I have two of these now, one for my office and one for the home office. Super Reliable from a manufacturer I have not heard of before, but keep an eye out for now!
customer_reviews.author: Perry E.

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I see the thousands of positive reviews here -- that's why I decided to take my chances. But ever since I plugged this device into my computer, I've had nonstop power surges to the USB port. Sometimes it works anyway, but clearly my PC hates it. I'll soon be replacing it with something of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Davy

customer_reviews.title: Convenience on Desk
customer_reviews.text: Bought to connect to powered USB 3.0 port on back of desktop PC. Have front port, but didn't want cords around box. This works perfect and cord is nice length to swing up on my work desk in great location to give me great access to plug in my USB flash drives and portable HDD without the bending and headaches.
customer_reviews.author: G. Prokopp

customer_reviews.title: Slow data transfer
customer_reviews.text: Quality feels low and transfer rates for flash drives took an enormous hit. My drive went from 333 read / 267 write to 34 read / 34 write. I have a Patriot Rage 2, so it's at the top of the charts. I don't necessarily expect to keep those speeds, but it should be close. The hub was tested with only the flash drive and a Logitech mouse receiver plugged in. I compared speed tests with just a USB 3.0 extension cable, and speeds shot back up above 300. This hub is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Skylab Industries

customer_reviews.title: It works as expected. 4 USB 3.0 ports with good speed
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. 4 USB 3.0 ports with good speed. If you need 5v power you can add on the back. DC input 5v. The only negative point is that the cable is very thick. It is appreciated because it increases its durability but, this makes it difficult to keep it flat on the desk. However it is no reason to take away stars.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey W

customer_reviews.title: Cool solution
customer_reviews.text: This has been a perfect solution I had to reaching from my computer's USB to my printer's USB. Reason for 4 stars is it noticeable that the port do not all have the same power. But I've been able to work around it. Also is a great solution to the awkward positioning of the ports on my computer - I leave this plugged in and have the ports right in front of me rather than finagling with the computer.
customer_reviews.author: water

customer_reviews.title: A very serviceable converter
customer_reviews.text: converts 1 USB outlet to 3 in a small, flattish package. Remember that it's not a "powered" hub, but pretty much everything is happy without another external power source. Suggestion to manufacturer: It might be good to provide a little velcro square for mounting on the side of the destkop computer case.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife so she doesnt have to crawl under the desk to plug the usb in. I am going to miss that but I guess it will make her life easier haha. Works great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Honey Bunz

customer_reviews.title: Great Hub Regardless of Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this hub is everything I need. I did not purchase the power supply as I use the hub only for light duty service...thumb drives, wireless keyboard, mouse, etc). I tested transfer speed with a Toshiba 2TB 3.0 connected directly to my Acer's 3.0 slot and again connecting via the hub. The results were nearly identical. My only wish would be for a bit longer cable...another 12" would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Dawon

customer_reviews.title: Great USB expander
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for doing presentations from my Microsoft Surface. Because the Surface only has one USB, I needed extra slots. What I love about this one is that not only does it have the four slots, but it also has a power slot. I plug it into a micro USB and A/C power. That means that I can use multiple devices with a large electrical draw and not have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in AZ

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I have it gorilla taped to the top of my PC and all of my different random usb connectors can go in and out with ease. (I do recommend fastening it down somehow. Before I gorilla taped it, it was very annoying how it would slide around and fall off all the time.
customer_reviews.author: lownoteman

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Ugreen 4 port does the job. I connected my ethernet to it and there is no loss of speed. I'm beginning to like Ugreen products. They're a couple of bucks more expensive than other brands, but the quality seems to be there. I will buy again if I need a 4 port USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: Nemar

customer_reviews.title: Great little device, cable not detachable
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to help me stop reaching under my desk to unplug my mouse and keyboard. What I got was exactly that, plus a charging port, and I can use the top slot for my wireless headset receiver. Being able to bring that to the top of my desk increased my headset range enough to where I can walk outside and still chat with people. My only tiny gripe is wishing the main cable was detachable. All in all, very happy with my purchase. Considering buying another one for work!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: The 4 ports on the hub work. The problem is that when I connect a seperately powered hard drive and a usb drive, it stops reading the hard drive, even when the hard drive is seperately powered by its own adapter. If i attach two usb thumb drives and the hard drive, it reads the thumb drives but again, not the hard drive. If thr hard drive is plugged in alone, it will work. Otherwise seems this product cant handle what I need. Even if it is a very basic application of the product. I am giving it two stars because it works and reads just the thumb drives. Otherwise it wouldnt even be worth that.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bhandari

customer_reviews.title: Its ok adequate but the plugs are loose and the design is clunky for items to be plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: the company contacted me about my review. After doing some support it was found that the item I had was defective. They were willing to send me a new one, but cannot send from the manufacturer to PR so, they gave me a refund which is an acceptable resolution. Its ok adequate but the plugs are loose and the design is clunky for items to be plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great USB hub for all my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This 3.0 USB hub works perfectly with my set up. I have a WIFI adapter attached to the top (my wifi adapter is bulky and would have ended up blocking any USB ports next to it so having it at the top was perfect), keyboard and mouse attached to the front ports. This is a fantastic hub with good build quality and great design with the top USB port. I always thought that there would be latency issues, but it has been proven that there such little difference that it isn't worth mentioning. This allows me to have a much cleaner setup!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: 1. Not USB3. It has blue connectors but whenever I plugged my USB3 devices into it the computer said they would be faster if I actually used a USB3 port. 2. Worse than that, it caused lots of problems with my Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse, which took me a good while to figure out. This thing is going back.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: It seems that at least the one sent to me will not transmit data only power. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: vinmo

customer_reviews.title: Solid USB 3.0 hub
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got this at the end of a 30 foot extension for connecting a keyboard, mouse, flash drive, and DAC on the other side of my room from the computer. It works very well. I get full USB 3.0 speeds, and I really like the form factor with one port on top. It’s sturdy and well built. Not much else to say beyond that.
customer_reviews.author: Bigtrain3751

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I've been looking for. The cord length is plenty to route from the back of a desktop. The build quality is very good. Easy plug and play, no need to power it with an external usb unless you have power hungry devices attached
customer_reviews.author: Asiri

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I don't have to stand up every time I want to plug in a USB device. I like the longer cord, which makes it possible to set right on my desk. I have used it for flash drives, chargers and other connections and it has worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Diane, Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work well, I bought 2 of these and both of them stopped working as USB ports, my computer wouldn't recognize any USB devices when plugged in. It would still charge.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Q.

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Unit Failed After One Month.
customer_reviews.text: Used with my iMac. The hub went intermittent then failed to find thumb drives after one month. Replaced with another brand of data hub. That works correctly. JUST OUTSIDE THE DATE TO RETURN.
customer_reviews.author: John ZB

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of USB
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Surface Pro to increase the number of USB to 4, because it has only 1 USB .I store my work on thumb/SD drives. 3 ports are for the drives 1 port for my mouse receiver. The cord is a little long but ok.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bob

customer_reviews.title: Constant disconnects.
customer_reviews.text: Constantly disconnects/reconnects mouse, iphone, keyboard, recording devices--anything plugged into it. Pretty much fails for the one thing it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Using on my shield. I added a power adaptor because the smart things hub and thumb drive would drop off; no longer an issue. Added a 3 amp adapter as opposed to the 2 amp recommended. Like the small footprint but might need some double sided tape to secure
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: High quality hub
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of usb hubs and most of them were not good quality. So often, one or more ports would not work - a serious fail for a hub! I am very pleased with this hub. Its quality is apparent - neither flimsy nor loose nor tight. It feels good in hand and all the ports work as described. Win! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Great little USB splitter, nice thick cord. Had to take a star off because it caused my XBox wireless receiver to disconnect periodically, once during a boss fight. I moved the receiver to a mobo port after that.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Does the job as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up because I’ve got a few too many devices needing usb3 for my desktop computer. Seems to be well built and while I chose to add a power supply for it which adds a bit of baggage I’m not sure it was necessary and I would buy another one of these if the need arose.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Quality hub with a unique design
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. I quite like the design, with one USB port on top. I use it on my work desk and I find the top USB is the one I use most frequently. The quality of the materials and the cable is also very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Thanawalla

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I love having 4 USB ports for keyboard, headset, mouse with 1 free for thumb drive. I love the added bonus of the blue light indicating that it's properly connected to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia White

customer_reviews.title: It is just right for me.
customer_reviews.text: The 3 on the side will be good and the 1 USB port on the top will be used whenever I need to access a thumb drive for some quick reason. It was plug and play simple to put into use. The ports feel snug like I want them.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Majkrzak

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected, no external power supply needed. Macbook Pro 13" 2013-2015 model.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the low star reviews said this wouldn't charge anything so I got this expecting only peripherals to work. To my surprise it charges my Moto G4 (not rapid charge but not bad either) while I have my keyboard and mouse connected. I got this to expand the number of USB ports on my Macbook Pro 2013-2015 model. Works like a charm! I'm on day 3 of use, so far so good, I'll report back here if I encounter any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cain

customer_reviews.title: Works really well and looks good
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little hub. It's attractive and the USB Port on top is really helpful when plugging in my iPod to charge it and for USB Thumbdrives. So far I've had it for months without an issue
customer_reviews.author: jacksplat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me. Small, fast, and not too flashy.
customer_reviews.text: I like it because compared to most hubs, it's subtle, and I do like the port on the top as well. I use mostly wireless adapters (bluetooth adapter, headphone dongle, controller dongle) and they all work fine on this hub.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, helps when using a Yubikey
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for when I use my Yubikey and flash drives. It works great is small and compact But functional. I am buying a YubiNano 5 so I can leave it in there all the time for 2-factor authentication.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a wifi and mouse dongle extension. Works well (I power it with a dc power supply and it has a pretty standard tip size. I used the power supply from my last usb 2.0 bridge and the plug fit.)
customer_reviews.author: Blessings

customer_reviews.title: Great Little 4 Port 3.0 Hub!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. I use it to transfer video files in various formats from my pc to a WD Elements 2TB hard drive at 3.0 and I'm getting great speed without an external power source. That's what I wanted the least fuss for my money and I've had no problem with it. It's backwards compatible as well so it can replace your 2.0 hub. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard The Buying Hearted

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I plugged in my bluetooth dongle and my wireless mouse dongle to this hub and they basically don't work any more. Something is wrong with this hub,
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Replug on every connection
customer_reviews.text: Every time a USB device is plugged in, all devices on it drop, then get reconnected. I only use it for charging phones, bluetooth headsets, and tossing temporary thumb drives on it, wouldn't rely on it for things that have to stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: tisane

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: Works good so far. My only complaint is that the cable connecting the USB dock to the PC is not detachable from the hub itself. Would be nice to be able to swap the cable out if it was too long/short.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Elton

customer_reviews.title: Causes issues with PS4 controller when used at the same ...
customer_reviews.text: Causes issues with PS4 controller when used at the same time. I bought this to use with my PlayStation 4. I play a lot of Gran Turismo Sport and needed more USB outlets for my steering wheel, keyboard, and headset. No problems just using this hub without a controller. When you turn the controller on it causes the controller to stop responding randomly and also disconnect randomly. This has no effect on the hub or anything plugged into it. I use it almost everyday with no issues other than when I use the DS4 controller with it at the same time. Not sure if this is an issue with all USB hubs on a PS4 of just this one.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Morales

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality and Preformance!
customer_reviews.text: Better than I ever could have thought. I purchased to use with my PlayStation 4 and to be honest I wasn't sure how well it would work since I have never used a USB Port Hub with my system. This product worked excellent, connected imediately and works flawlessly with everything I connected to the USB Hub with my PlayStation 4. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Des Archer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything except for the port on the top of it. I think it makes the entire product look bulky when there's something plugged into that port. That's just me being picky though. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: GTT

customer_reviews.title: Quality port for PC's and MAC's
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extension to bring ports out to the front of my Win10 computer. Installed this in a minute. The computer beeped and everything worked. It’s nice to have 4 ports. It has a number of features: 1) Professional and modern electrical design. 2) Nice plastic box. 3) the 4th connector is on top. 3) Quality workmanship. 4) And, BTW, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Husband

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Usage
customer_reviews.text: This product is affordable and works without any issues. I really like that it has the top port so I have some customization in how I use it in different spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Weiss

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is about as no-frills a usb hub as you can find. Functional but nothing more than that. Thing is cheap plastic with no heft to it at all. It'll slide all over your desk and won't sit flush on the surface due to the lack of weight and thick USB cable sticking out the back. Spend $10 more for an aluminum USB hub with rubber feet to keep it in one place.
customer_reviews.author: rek

customer_reviews.title: beautiful piece of electronic.
customer_reviews.text: i think i will buy some more again. this thing is very beautiful. the cable length is absolutely correct. the cable itself is thick and looks pro. Hub is damm beautiful and stable. the price is just the part of it.
customer_reviews.author: monish

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. All 3.0 ports which a huge plus. The only thing I wish I had done was get one with 6-10 ports. Once you plug this bad boy into your 3.0 port you will want to plug everything into it. I use two computer side by side with 3 monitors and I need all the USB ports I can get. Just think about what you need when you purchase your product carefully. Fast shipping and item is as described. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Hall

customer_reviews.title: It is okay
customer_reviews.text: It is okay. But I found it to be flimsy and not very sturdy. As long as I leave it in one place I think it will be okay. I had planned to pack it with my laptop, but I don't think it would be able to withstand being moved around a lot. It will work okay with my desktop. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: antlereflyod

customer_reviews.title: Really Good!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good USB 3.0 Hub (Like me) for cheap, This is it! I bought this USB Hub because I had little to no USB Ports in my Laptop (only 3) I gave these a try and it powers a Razer Blackwidow X RGB keyboard, Corsair Harpoon RGB mouse, and even my recently purchased Blue Snowball iCE! I also charged my phone and used a SATA to USB Adapter for data transfer and all that. Give these a try if you are interested in buying this!
customer_reviews.author: shella marie gutierrez bolesa

customer_reviews.title: OK but not great
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This USB hub also needs a power source to work and the power cable is not included. So, you must have your own micro USB cable, which also takes up another USB port on your machine. Therefore the 4 ports are really just 2 added since you need 2 ports for the product to actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Wayy to light! But perfect layout.
customer_reviews.text: The overall piece needs to be much heavier to allow for a USB stick to be inserted one handed. Also the cable it comes with is to stiff. I used 3m strips to keep it in place so overall I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Myke

customer_reviews.title: Simple.  Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price. Prompt delivery. Easy to install. Works fine so far. The directions regarding printers were confusing, but I think they mean that you can't power the printer from the USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Works great as an extra USB to connect to my laptop. Only issue is that it doesn't provide charging capability, so I plug my mouse and keyboard into it and phone directly into the laptop. .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! No issues.
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my work laptop as our new laptops have fewer USB ports and i need ports for my supplemental keyboard, DVD drive and wireless mouse. This works great. No lag in keyboard or mouse speed when using this.
customer_reviews.author: H. MilesTop Contributor: Travel

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with my Surface Pro 3 with no issues. I've connected two usb flash/thumb drives and it transferred flawlessly. I ordered the recommended power adapter because I have two WD external drives I've been waiting for this hub to access with. This hub is lightweight and the cord is an adequate length to use on a desk without feeling too long to be tangled up into. Overall great product and I'm very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Blazinferno

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3.0 Hub
customer_reviews.text: Works great just would like to get a hub that can really support multiple power hungry devices! The 5v micro USB port is a great addition but I want even more power!
customer_reviews.author: Digital David - LLC

customer_reviews.title: I especially like the top port that allow somewhat bulky connector to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. I use it to connect multiple USB 3.0 hard disks and a usb audio DAC to a laptop USB 3.0 port and the transfer speed and audio quality are as expected. I especially like the top port that allow somewhat bulky connector to fit in the port by itself, not that I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Cy

customer_reviews.title: Not working as expected
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, when I connect my mouse to this USB port and then connect the USB port to my laptop, my mouse encounters hiccups from time to time (i.e., there is a delay in the reaction of the mouse from time to time). My keyboard, when connecting to my laptop via this USB port, is working properly though. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: colorfulorange

customer_reviews.title: The thing I like most about it is the USB connection port on ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed more ports for my Microsoft Surface. This USB hub connected immediately. The thing I like most about it is the USB connection port on the top of the device. It's so handy when you want to plug a thumb drive without any hassle. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisk

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t charge apple products.
customer_reviews.text: Product does not appear to charge apple products. I plug my iPad or iPhone into hub with the devices’s cord and it does not charge. I take the device and it’s cord and place it in another usb charger and it charges fine. Not happy that the product doesn’t charge my devices despite the power light being on in the hub.
customer_reviews.author: William CULP

customer_reviews.title: UGreen
customer_reviews.text: If you are need of some extra ports on your desktop waste no more time and purchase this item! It gets my approval!
customer_reviews.author: Tarrell M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great hub, solid construction and price
customer_reviews.text: I have a gaming rig and work computer and wanted to switch my mouse and keyboard between the two and not have to crawl under my desk to use the USB ports for either. Enter these two hubs - one for gaming and one for work. And for the price - you can’t beat it. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: FooBear408

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old 2.0 4 port hub. This is even better because of the long cord. I've had it for a few days and it's working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: David Raamiah

customer_reviews.title: Elegant
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to run as advertised. Nice that the newer gen of usb hub don't require additional power. Charges my phone and headphones just fine and that little top port is perfect for my mouse/keyboard receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Babble

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Ran out of ports on an iMAC. Used this to facilitate a USB WiFi adapter and plugged in the mouse as well. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Best USB Hub Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 3.0 hub, honestly the best I've ever used. I run two printers and an external hard drive through it, all work perfectly, no external power source required. For the price... unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: honestjuan

customer_reviews.title: Read the small print
customer_reviews.text: Beware, needs separate charger if you are going to use items like printer and scanners
customer_reviews.author: Dr. William Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. Works great and the long cord is perfect for running from the inside of the PC (to a USB 3.0 card). The long cord would be a problem for a laptop user for sure, It's way too long to be lugging around.
customer_reviews.author: WDeVercelly

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as a USB Hub for my PC
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a USB Hub for my PC. After reading other user reviews, and looking at the product specifications, I ordered the power adapter to go with it so that I wouldn't have any issues with my external hard drives, and I haven't had any issues with any of my devices I plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Good Design But Mouse Disabled
customer_reviews.text: Nice, functional deign. Unfortunately, Mouse appears disabled when connected to Hub with other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Member Since 2010

customer_reviews.title: Cheap build quality
customer_reviews.text: Feels very cheap. The cord is very stiff and the hub light so it moves all over the desk. Didn't even risk plugging in something with such poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: SDRiding

customer_reviews.title: Great little USB 3.0 4-port hub
customer_reviews.text: Great little USB hub. The cable is of good quality albeit a bit stiff. Only downside I can see is the cable could be a tad longer but otherwise an excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It works. It's useful. It has a bright blue light on it that I hate, but it works and it's useful.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Wofford

customer_reviews.title: Mess up my PS4 after  couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: Sooo I don't mostly do this but this is true so here, when i got it it was good for a couple of weeks then later on it just messing up and start messing up my wireless connection to my ps4 (i did not know by the time) and start doing delay move too, i just thought start my ps4 somehow start messing up so i put it on sell on ebay, the day right after i was about to sent it away i took out usb hub out of the ps4 and the connection start working again so yeaaa, i got me a new one anyway but just wanted to say this to yall
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Compact Design
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat USB hub. It is small and will take up very little space on your desk. You may want to purchase a USB extension cable if your PC is on the floor and you want to set the hub on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Hiland Watts

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Connected devices had no trouble with power
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple power hungry devices hooked up to this baby right now. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: ShimaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my live EDM setup. My computer sits up on a stand and I didn't want a hub with a short cable dangling in the air. Perfect solution, it's working well and I like the layout of the ports plus the little unobtrusive blue light that lets me know it's working
customer_reviews.author: Spacetime

product_meta.title: UGREEN 4 Port USB Hub 3.0 Data Hub with 3ft Portable Extension Cable High Speed Compatible for MacBook Air, Mac Mini, iMac Pro, Microsoft Surface, Ultrabooks, Black
feature_bullets: UGREEN 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub: Connects up to 4 USB devices to your PC or Laptop, such as external hard drives, USB flash drives, mouse, keyboard, USB headphone, speakers, memory cards, keyboard, mouse and much more USB devices, etc. It keeps you away from the trouble of plugging& unplugging repeatedly.

5GBPS Super Speed USB Hub: USB extension Hub supports super faster data transfer up to 5Gbps- 10X faster than USB 2.0 Hub(480 Mbps), which can transfer HD movies or files in just seconds. It is backward compatible with USB 2.0, 1.1 and 1.0. The LED status makes it easy to monitor the connection status.

With 3FT USB 3.0 Extension Cable: This USB 3.0 powered hub with extended cable can extend hard-to-reach USB ports on your desktop to your desired location, which makes it a nice choice for desktop. Moreover, the handy and compact design offers an ideal way to fast access to your USB devices anywhere.
Wide Compatibility: USB splitter is compatible with Windows 10/8/8.1/7 / Vista / XP and Mac OS X, Linux and Chrome OS. Plug & play, no driver needed.
Stable and Secure: With built-in protection for over-voltage and over-current, this 4 port USB charging hub can keep your digital devices and data safe.

specifications.Operating System: Linux, Windows Vista, Chrome OS, Windows 10
